What is the critical *chi* square value in this test with a significance
level  alpha= 0.05?

Answerlist
----------
* 1.96
* 3.84
* 5.99
* 124.3

Solution
========





The degrees of freedom (df) is 2 and alpha=0.05, so the critical value
of *chi* square is 5.99 (see table)  
(1.96 is the critical value of the *t* distribution with more than 100
degrees of freedom. )  
(3.84 is the critical value of the *chi* square distribution if there is
only one degree of freedom)  
(124.3 is the critical value of the *chi* square distribution if there
are 100 degrees of freedom)
